free_text.Learning outcomes: Gaining an overview of central optimization methods in statistics, ranging from the basic techniques up to methods employed in high-dimensional statistics.[br/]
free_text.Content: Introduction to Karush-Kuhn-Tucker theory and convexity; majorization-maximization algorithm and applications; Newton's method and variants, conjugate gradient method and convergence analysis; background results from convex analysis; duality theory; algorithms for convex optimization (e.g. proximal methods, homotopy methods, interior point methods); applications to statistical problems.[br/]
free_text.Keywords: convex analysis; optimization; high dimensional statistics
free_text.Prerequisite for: real analysis; elementary topology; multivariate statistics
